website_summaries.verdict: The PSP Headset is a perfectly good set of bargain headphones, but why Sony didn't include the accessory needed to enable the microphone is beyond us.
pros: allows for in-game and Skype chat sessions on your PSP
earclip design makes for comfortable, stable fit
cons: Requires a separately sold remote control accessory for microphone functionality to work
open design doesn't shut out external noise

customer_reviews.title: The most comfortable headphones I've ever worn
customer_reviews.text: I had PSP headsets before, years ago, but they broke and I just never got around to getting another headset. I finally got one, though, because the PSP headset can be used on smart phones and the like. These are just as comfortable as I remember. I often forget I am even wearing them. They sound as perfect as anyone could expect, given their price point and size. Too bad Sony does not still make these.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck Nasty

customer_reviews.title: Been looking for these for a while...
customer_reviews.text: Found these in a Gamestop years ago after I got my PSP and broke them over the years of use. These are some of the best headphones I have ever used. They reproduce sound way better than other headphones in the same price range. The mic makes it useful for cell phones as well. Love it and not surprised I found it on Amazon! :)
customer_reviews.author: Mile High Prophet

customer_reviews.title: Works only well with the PSP. I tried plugging ...
customer_reviews.text: Works only well with the PSP. I tried plugging these into my Droid DNA and they never get recognized at all. PSP, I've never ran into problems with these headphones. Comfy too.
customer_reviews.author: Friend

customer_reviews.title: Excelent work Sony!
customer_reviews.text: The headset works just fine, have a nice design and nice sound. I still think the PSP doesn't have enough sound power either on their built in speakers or headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Mau Urena A

customer_reviews.title: I heard that!
customer_reviews.text: These are very comfortable to wear. The sound quality is amazing. There high quality. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Edward

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: My husband is an avid SOCOM player. As most of you who play know, a mic is a must. When I purchased his PSP I noted that it didn't come with a mic and purchased this one. The only thing I didn't know is that you have to have the control piece or it won't work. He's had it for 3 months now and uses it 3 or 4 times a week, hasn't failed him yet.
customer_reviews.author: jewel464g

customer_reviews.title: not the greatest
customer_reviews.text: i cannot get the phone part to work on my psp even though it does work. comfort is ok
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound from these..
customer_reviews.text: During game play or just listening to music and my daughter likes the fact that she can talk with her cousins while they play.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan B

customer_reviews.title: PSP Headset
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound quality, but do not like all the cabling required to get it working. I heard Sony is launching a newer one.
customer_reviews.author: Ferns

customer_reviews.title: thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: bought it for my boyfriend he loved them even tho he hasn't tried them because he still using his beat up ones lol
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: not for psp 2001
customer_reviews.text: Sony changed the plug on the PSP with the 2001 series. The original plug is thicker and has three contacts on each side of the rectangular part of the plug (3.5mm headphone jack is standard on both). The new plug is thinner and has more contacts (5 or 6.. I haven't bought a remote). I too bought a headset for skype but found that it was only for the old PSP.
customer_reviews.author: D. Galloway

customer_reviews.title: Headset incomplete
customer_reviews.text: I enjoyed the headset but I was disappointed because in the picture, when I look at it, it showed including the remote control to use the microphone but when I opened it I realized that I had to purchase the remote control which I did. But it cost me more and more time.
customer_reviews.author: Juanchis

customer_reviews.title: "Can you hear me now?" PSP Headset
customer_reviews.text: A nice piece of work. I personally bought it at EB Games, but you could wait until you can buy it here at Amazon. The sound quality is good, and the talking feature rules, but when faced with lag I was subject to a hissing noise. Maybe my product is defective, maybe not. In any case, it's super fun, and necessary to join clans /cells on such games as Syphon Filter: Dark Mirror, and Socom: Fireteam Bravo. A must have for the infrastructure PSP gamer!
customer_reviews.author: The One Who Knows

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: worked great once i got my remote so i could connect it to my psp 2000 vs
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy !
customer_reviews.text: JUNK! My mic doesn't work at all. The other reviewer is the only person that i've heard of that it actually works. I've read alot about other gamers casque mics not working either. Do not buy! Save your money. It also doesn't tell you, you need the psp remote that comes with the more expensive psp box. So i wasted 40 bucks on nothing!
customer_reviews.author: B. Gorman

product_meta.title: PSP Headset
product_meta.description: Reproduce the rich, dynamic sound of the PSP / Offers communication features for all compatible PSP titles / High-quality construction and shielded cable
feature_bullets: PSP headphones for listening to games and other audio
